intro: Ossaea amygdaloides f. pauciflora, commonly known as the sparse-flowered almondleaf, is a rare and distinctive plant species belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves that resemble those of the genus Ossaea, with a delicate, almost lace-like appearance. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels, which are clustered in a loose, open inflorescence. It is typically found in rocky or gravelly soils in arid or semi-arid regions. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
